SENT.plain: A 10-year-old girl with aplastic anemia received an allogeneic bone marrow transplantation (BMT)

Three years after an uneventful course apart from chronic graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) she presented with chronic hypoxemia, reduced diffusion capacity of the lungs, normal spirometric lung function and increased bilirubin and liver enzymes
Pulmonary complications after BMT may include a hepatopulmonary syndrome (liver disease, hypoxemia, intrapulmonary vascular dilatations)
